valr

Generate randomly placed intervals on a genome.

Generate randomly placed intervals on a genome.

bed_random(genome, length = 1000, n = 1e+06, seed = 0)

Arguments

genome
genome tbl
length
length of intervals
n
number of intervals to generate
seed
seed RNG for reproducible intervals

See also

http://bedtools.readthedocs.org/en/latest/content/tools/random.html

Other single-set-ops: bed_cluster, bed_complement, bed_flank, bed_merge, bed_shift, bed_shuffle, bed_slop

Examples 

genome <- tibble::tribble(
  ~chrom,  ~size,
  "chr1",  10000000,
  "chr2",  50000000,
  "chr3",  60000000,
  "chrX",  5000000
)

# random intervals (unsorted)
bed_random(genome, seed = 10104)
#> # A tibble: 1,000,000 × 3
#>    chrom    start      end
#>    <chr>    <int>    <int>
#> 1   chr3 57732458 57733458
#> 2   chr3  3718192  3719192
#> 3   chr2 14303923 14304923
#> 4   chr2 35002562 35003562
#> 5   chr3 41721327 41722327
#> 6   chr3 57830589 57831589
#> 7   chr3 42197909 42198909
#> 8   chrX  3787840  3788840
#> 9   chr3 33492118 33493118
#> 10  chr2 14530350 14531350
#> # ... with 999,990 more rows
#> 

# 500 random intervals of length 500 
bed_random(genome, length = 500, n = 500, seed = 10104)
#> # A tibble: 500 × 3
#>    chrom    start      end
#>    <chr>    <int>    <int>
#> 1   chr3 57732458 57732958
#> 2   chr3  3718192  3718692
#> 3   chr2 14303923 14304423
#> 4   chr2 35002562 35003062
#> 5   chr3 41721327 41721827
#> 6   chr3 57830589 57831089
#> 7   chr3 42197909 42198409
#> 8   chrX  3787840  3788340
#> 9   chr3 33492118 33492618
#> 10  chr2 14530350 14530850
#> # ... with 490 more rows
#>
